title: BBC Local Live: Greater Manchester on Wednesday 14 September 2016 - BBC News
summary: greater manchester deals with aftermath of huge thunderstorm .
hospitals in manchester given £ 28m to research diagnosis and treatment of diseases .
man city to belatedly start champions league campaign in rescheduled game .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates from greater manchester and east cheshire have finished for the day , but we 'll be back from 08:00 on thursday with the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the region .

documents.title: weather : a muggy night awaits
text: any showers will soon clear to leave a dry , mild and muggy night with light winds and some mist in places .
it wo n't get below 18c .
more from bbc weather
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: football : herrera wants to win europa league with man utd
text: manchester united midfielder ander herrera says he wants to win the europa league , even though he believes the club belong in the champions league .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: football : rooney omitted from man utd squad
text: striker wayne rooney has been left out of manchester united 's 20-man squad for thursday 's europa league tie in rotterdam against dutch side feyenoord .
despite training on wednesday , the 30-year-old captain will miss the club 's european opener , as will luke shaw , antonio valencia and jesse lingard .
henrikh mkhitaryan and phil jones did not train and will also be absent .
manager jose mourinho has said striker marcus rashford will make his first start of the season in the group a tie .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: bragg investigates the matter of the north
text: in the last programme in the series , the matter of the north , broadcaster melvyn bragg has celebrated the power of northern voices in our sporting life , and asked what being and sounding northern means more generally .
author: BBC Radio 4

documents.title: paralym 2016 : dame sarah 's 13th gold medal in
text: dame sarah storey , britain 's most successful female paralympian , has won the road cycling c5 time trial to take her 13th paralympic gold medal - and here 's how it looked :
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: ten held in class a drugs raids
text: ten people have been arrested following drugs raids in manchester and merseyside .
police carried out eight searches into the supply of class a drugs earlier .
the eight men and two women , aged between 27 and 56 and from the manchester and liverpool areas , have been arrested , the north west 's organised anti-crime unit , titan , said .
det supt jason hudson said : `` we will continue to target those that supply and distribute controlled drugs in our community and this investigation is part of that process . ''

documents.title: two held after northern quarter violence
text: two men have been arrested following violent clashes on saturday in manchester 's northern quarter .
trouble broke out shortly after 18:10 at the junction of hilton street and tib street .
men aged 20 and 24 have been arrested on sus of violent disorder and remain in custody for questioning .
witnesses , particularly those who may have footage of the incident , are asked to contact greater manchester police ( gmp ) or crimestoppers .
detective sergeant patrick connell , of gmp 's city of manchester team , said : we have arrested two people who remain in custody but our investigation continues . ''

documents.title: travel : four-car crash causes m60 delays
text: a crash involving four cars has resulted in a lane closure and queuing traffic on the m60 anti-clockwise at junction 1 , the stockport pyramid .
congestion goes back to junction 5 , princess parkway , while the m56 to junction 4 , wythenshawe , is also busier than usual .
more from bbc travel
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: prime minister 's questions : schools ' water bills raised
text: a greater manchester mp is urging the government to force united utilities to reduce the cost of water bills faced by schools across the north west .

mp mary robinson asked theresa may about the issue at prime minister 's questions , and said she wanted schools to be classed as `` community assets '' , so they be charged on a different banding system .
schools in the region pay £ 27m a year for water charges , while those in the south of england pay just £ 11m .

documents.title: latest headlines in greater manchester and east cheshire
text: latest headlines in greater manchester and east cheshire

documents.title: teacher banned after leaving pupils alone to go boozing on lourdes trip
text: a teacher who left pupils alone while he went boozing until 04:00 during a trip to lourdes has been banned from the profession .
author: Manchester Evening News

documents.title: grammar schools : what are they and why are they controversial ?
text: wigan mp lisa nandy has criticised prime minister theresa may 's plans to introduce new grammar schools - but what are grammar schools ?
news answers some of the key questions about the schools and poses some 11-plus questions for readers to tackle .

documents.title: paralym 2016 : dame sarah 's 13 golds
text: dame sarah storey , who has won the road cycling c5 time trial , now has 13 paralympic gold medals - though not all of them were for cycling .
dame sarah from eccles started her gold rush as a swimmer in barcelona in 1992 before switching to cycling in beijing in 2008 .
here is a rundown of her golds :
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: travel : collapsed manhole closes whitefield road
text: radcliffe new road in whitefield is closed in both directions between the dales lane junction and the blackburn street junction because of emergency repairs following a collapsed manhole .
a diversion via dales lane , ringley road and stand lane is in place .
more from bbc travel
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: wigan building on endangered buildings list
text: rylands mill in wigan has been put on a national architectural charity 's endangered buildings list .
the former cotton mill , which reportedly held 60,000 spindles and 1,500 looms , was last occupied by wigan and leigh college but has been derelict since the early 2000s .
the grade ii-listed building is currently on sale for £ 2.5m .
i hope people living near these buildings will seize this opportunity and campaign to save them .

documents.title: paralym 2016 : dame sarah storey wins time trial for 13th gold
text: britain 's dame sarah storey claimed her 13th paralympic gold medal by winning the road cycling c5 time trial in rio .
her victory took gb to 35 golds , surpassing their tally at london 2012 .
storey has now won two events at these games , her triumph in the 3km pursuit on the track making her britain 's most successful female paralympian .
the 38-year-old from eccles , who was born without a functioning left hand , has won 24 paralympic medals since her first games as a swimmer in 1992 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: latest headlines for greater manchester and east cheshire
text: latest headlines for greater manchester and east cheshire

documents.title: clash over grammar schools continues
text: labour 's lisa nandy , mp for wigan has said theresa may 's plans to introduce new grammar schools are hugely divisive and marks the end of her `` honeymoon period '' as prime minister .
speaking at prime minister 's questions , labour leader jeremy corbyn said grammar schools segregated children , with the vast majority losing out .
ms nandy agrees , saying :
her first big idea as prime minister is to go back to the 1950s and condemn millions of children to failure .
she has n't just managed to unite the labour party on that but she has also managed to provoke a row with some very senior figures on her own side .

documents.title: clean-up continues in stockport
text: the clean-up is continuing in parts of greater manchester after last night 's storms and several flood warnings remain in place .
more businesses in bramhall cleaning up after last night 's storm

documents.title: tram tickets to manchester city game valid for rescheduled fixture
text: metrolink tickets bought last night to get to the postponed champions league match at the etihad can be reused for tonight 's rearranged fixture .
torrential rain during last night 's thunderstorms forced manchester city 's match against borussia monchengladbach to be abandoned and suspended tram services across the network .
transport for greater manchester 's head of customer services , rachel spencer , said : no-one could have predicted the extent and impact of the storm .
`` we will be honouring the tickets bought by those fans who braved the conditions only to find the match postponed . ''

documents.title: norman the terrier found in rabbit hole
text: adam yates feared the worst when his pet terrier norman disappeared during his walk around manchester 's heaton park .
after a day-and-a-half of frantic worrying - norman was finally found - stuck deep inside a rabbit warren .
ian haslam takes up the story .

documents.title: passenger arrested 'for being drunk and abusive '
text: a man has been arrested at manchester airport after he was reported for being drunk and behaving in an abusive manner .
he was trying to board a flight to las vegas - but was refused entry .
he has been arrested on sus of public order offences .

documents.title: 'landmark ' £ 28m boost for region 's nhs
text: a grant of more than £ 28m has been awarded to greater manchester 's devolved health service to pay for research into new tests and treatments .
the money was awarded as the region 's hospitals were granted biomedical research centre status , in what has been described as a `` landmark moment '' .
it will be used to drive forward research into cancer , respiratory disease and other serious conditions .
millions of people will benefit , the region 's nhs trusts said .

documents.title: mum speaks out after horror dog attack on 16-year-old girl
text: a mum says she thought her daughter was going to die as she was savaged in the street by a neighbour 's dog .
author: Manchester Evening News
Manchester Evening News

documents.title: football : aguero set to return for man city
text: sergio aguero is set to return and ilkay gundogan could make his debut as manchester city belatedly begin their champions league campaign against borussia monchengladbach .
the match takes place 24 hours later than originally scheduled after being postponed because of the massive thunderstorm and torrential rain .
striker aguero , 28 , is one game into a three-match domestic suspension but is able to face the german side .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: paralym 2016 : dame sarah on course for 13th medal
text: dame sarah storey has set the fastest time so far at the halfway mark of the c5 time trial at the rio paralym
she clocked 13 minutes 57.69 seconds at the end of the first 10km lap .
the 38-year-old is chasing her 13th paralympic gold medal with her first coming in 1992 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: your lightning in lees
text: weather watcher rita took this photo of lightning in lees during last night 's storm .

documents.title: travel : disruption on m61 manchester
text: one lane is closed on the exit slip road on the southbound m61 at junction 5 ( westhoughton ) , because of a broken down vehicle .
more from bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: latest headlines for greater manchester and east cheshire
text: latest headlines for greater manchester and east cheshire

documents.title: robots to feature at manchester city games
text: manchester city say they want to bring fans a `` unique experience '' at matches by giving them the chance to be filmed interacting with robots before and after games .
the robots can mimic the movements of humans and they are about knee-high sized .
the club has joined forces with ubtech robotics corp for the project which will feature on the club 's digital channels and a plan for manchester city-branded robots is also being discussed .

documents.title: murderer absconds from open prison
text: a 51-year-old convicted murderer , whose last known address was oldham , has absconded from an open prison in derbyshire .
darren jackson was serving part of his life sentence at hmp sudbury when he disappeared on tuesday .
jackson , who was sentenced in march 1986 , had been released and later recalled to the prison .

documents.title: lightning hits ramsbottom during last night 's storm
text: reporter victoria gill filmed the storm while travelling as a passenger on the m66 near ramsbottom .

documents.title: hs2 'needs realistic timetable ' , say mps
text: mps say the hs2 rail link needs a `` realistic timetable '' and believe the current schedule is `` overly ambitious '' .
the public accounts committee sais it was `` not convinced '' that the first phase of the £ 56bn rail line - linking london and birmingham - will open at the end of 2026 as planned .
it also urged the government to clarify the route and costs for the second phase , linking to manchester and leeds .
a government spokesperson said the project was `` on time and on budget '' .

documents.title: over 100 emergency calls made during storms
text: greater manchester fire and rescue service reported `` high numbers '' of 999 calls made after the storms hit the area last night .
gmfrs said it received 106 calls between 18:30 and 20:00 from people reporting flooding and weather-related issues .
they included a woman and children trapped inside a car in flood water under a railway bridge in stockport and electrical faults caused by flooding water .

documents.title: manchester apartment block car park flooded
text: the underground car park of an apartment block in manchester green quarter , near to victoria station , was badly flooded in the storms .

water levels have risen in the car park in cypress place and resident saroj shoker said : `` i woke up this morning to the find the staircase down to level -3 flooded and barriers up to stop people accessing the car park from both inside and outside . ''
she said she was `` devastated '' and concerned to hear this had happened before and almost 30 cars were written off last time .
staff from city living have been working since the early hours trying to pump the water out but it could take days , residents have been told .

documents.title: research funding of £ 28m given to hospitals
text: hospitals in manchester have been given more than £ 28m to work together on research into the diagnosis and treatment of diseases - including cancer and respiratory conditions .
the central manchester trust will work with the trusts in salford , south manchester , the christie and manchester university to become a centre of excellence for biomedical research .

documents.title: latest headlines for greater manchester and east cheshire
text: latest headlines for greater manchester and east cheshire

documents.title: local businesses clean up after storms
text: many businesses were flooded on the high street in bramhall , stockport .
the clean up is now under way .
clean up underway at costa in bramhall one of the many businesses in the high street flooded in last night 's storm .
the moment the floodwater started to run into costa in bramhall in last night 's storm

documents.title: flood warnings in place across manchester
text: the environment agency has eight flood warnings in place following last night 's storm for areas across manchester , including :
find the latest flood warning information here .

documents.title: last night 's lightning storm in manchester
text: lightning flashed across manchester last night after torrential downpours .

documents.title: football : man city to face borussia monchengladbach later in rescheduled game
text: manchester city 's postponed champions league group match against borussia monchengladbach has been rescheduled for tonight at 19:45 .
tickets bought for the scheduled tuesday match will still be valid - heavy rain , thunder and lightning forced the group c match to be abandoned .
in a statement , city said localised flooding led to a decision being made on `` safety and security grounds '' .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: how much rain was there ?
text: meteorologist mark wilson said there was a lot of rain in a `` very short space of time '' in the region and `` a lot '' of thunder and lightning .
mr wilson said : `` prestbury had 32.4mm of rain in an hour - which is pretty exceptional . ''

documents.title: flooding in manchester city centre
text: market street was like a paddling pool this morning .
clear up continues this morning after last night 's storms .
holly hamilton filmed this flooding in market st , mcr .
those kids need a good fucking hiding
surely this happens in manchester only because of blocked drains .

documents.title: your storm in reddish
text: crispin edwards captured this image of the lightning in reddish , stockport .
send your photographs by email , facebook or twitter .

documents.title: metrolink services restored
text: metrolink services will run on all lines this morning after engineers worked through the night to repair damage caused by multiple lightning strikes , transport for greater manchester said .
the lightning affected power to signalling systems as well as the overhead lines .
the altrincham and bury lines were both suspended for the evening .

documents.title: headlines for greater manchester and east cheshire
text: headlines for greater manchester and east cheshire

documents.title: travel : crash on m6 cheshire
text: one lane is closed and there is slow traffic on the m6 northbound between junction 17 ( sandbach ) and junction 18 ( middlewich ) , because of an accident involving two vehicles .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: storms strike transport and football in manchester
text: torrential storms struck greater manchester 's transport system and caused the postponement of manchester city 's champions league game .
the metrolink suspended all tram lines due to lightning strikes and manchester airport had to divert incoming flights .
manchester city 's champions league group clash at home to german side borussia mönchengladbach was postponed less than half an hour before kick off due to a flooded etihad stadium pitch .
surface water caused delays on the roads and to trains in the region .

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live news coverage
text: the calm after the storm .
after a wild night of weather welcome to greater manchester live .
we 're here until 18:00 with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather from across the 10 boroughs and east cheshire .
author: Rachael Connors
Reporter, BBC News Online
